title: What can I do to stay focused while I'm sleepy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Take a caffeine nap! Experiments have shown that caffeine naps are better than naps or caffeine alone. (Scientists agree: Coffee naps are better than coffee or naps alone) The idea is you want to intake some caffeine quickly, and then go down for a 15–20 minute nap. The experiments showed that people who take a caffeine nap over just a nap or just caffeine performed better in memory tests and had less errors in a driving simulator test. 2. Find the root of the problem. Rather than resorting to tricks like putting ice cubes on your wrists… identify the root cause! Did you only get 6 hours of sleep last night. Perhaps you work better with 7.5, or even 9. Ok, now you’re getting 9 and maybe you’re tired. Perhaps it is diet related. You may be eating tons of refined carbs, which make you feel up and down and overall terrible throughout the day. If this is the case, look into trying to ketogenic diet. Where you basically avoid all refined carbs, and eat heavily in healthy fats. You’ll feel much more satiated throughout the entire day, and will avoid the common crash that many carb consumers feel throughout numerous parts of their day.

Exercise to Increase Energy and Reduce FatigueIn an analysis of 70 studies involving more than 6,800 people, University of Georgia researchers found that exercise was more effective in increasing energy and reducing daytime fatigue than some medications used to treat sleep problems. Regular exercise also improves quality of sleep.  SOURCE:How to Stay Focused: Top 5 Effective Tips Get up and move a littleEven a quick jog around the block can do the trick to get your heart pumping, send some much-needed oxygen to the brain, and provide a rush of endorphins for a fast energy boost, according to Everyday Health. I know it may feel like the last thing you want to do, but seriously, it'll be worth it. Do the easier TasksOK, so if you are super exhausted right now, try to stick with some of the more simple tasks you have to get done, like organizing your desk or answering emails. Maybe today isn't the day to tackle the most difficult parts of a project. Have g good laughA good laugh and a quick break will undoubtedly put some pep back in your step. As Dr. Lee Berk, an associate professor at Loma Linda University in California, told TIME, laughing can have a positive "ripple" effect for both your brain and your body.  SOURCE:11 Tips to Stay Productive When You're Tired (Infographic) Go outsideThe more you can expose yourself to sunlight, Brantner says, the more awake you'll feel, and you'll also have a better ability to reset your sleep cycle to guarantee a good snooze later on, which will hopefully stop your sleepy struggles from ruining your productivity in the long run. Switch Tasks to Stimulate Your MindIn 2004 Finnish researchers who studied people working 12-hour night shifts found that monotonous work is as harmful as sleep loss for alertness. At work or home, try to reserve more stimulating tasks for your sleepy times. Or switch to more engaging work responsibilities when you feel yourself nodding off.
